history.content:
Hey everyone,

 

I hope your semester is off to a good start! The Bioengineering Honor Society is hosting its 8th annual BioEHSC™, the nation’s largest Bioengineering High School Competition! We’re looking for students like you who are willing to mentor teams from all backgrounds. As a mentor, you will be guiding a high school team in designing a biological or medical engineering project, which they will present in a final research symposium on April 10th. You can use this opportunity to help students by bringing in your EE/CS interest and background to biological/medical applications.

 

Mentors have the option of receiving 2 P/NP units, and this also looks great on Med/Grad school apps, NSF, and other grants or scholarships! 

 

Please come out to our virtual mentor info session on NEXT FRIDAY, Feb. 5th from 6:00-7:00pm to learn more about this amazing opportunity. You can also register as a mentor now at bit.ly/2021MentorRegistration! 

 

For detailed information on the competition, visit bioehs.berkeley.edu/bioehsc, or email us at bioehsc@bioehs.berkeley.edu.
history.subject: Mentorship opportunity for High School Bioengineering Competition!
